intro: Hoffmannia rzedowskiana, commonly known as the Mexican hoffmannia, is a rare and endemic species native to the cloud forests of Mexico. It is a small shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and distinctive, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its botanical features include narrow, leathery leaves and fragrant, pale yellow blooms that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Hoffmannia rzedowskiana is considered a species of conservation concern.
